elementSpec.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.

attDef.desc: gives the value of the time in standard form, e.g. as hh:mm.
attDef.valDesc: A string representing a time in standard format as defined in XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition, except that times may be expressed with reduced precision (e.g., 12 and 12:00 are permitted to indicate noon, in addition to 12:00:00). Software intended for use with W3C XML Schema datatypes may be unable to properly process times expressed with reduced precision.

exemplum.egXML: He likes to be punctual. I said around noon, and he showed up at 12 O'clock on the dot.

remarks.p: The value of value is constrained to be in one of the date formats recognized by the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes specification, except that times may be expressed with reduced precision. This is true whether the date component (if any) is a Gregorian or a proleptic Gregorian date.
Note that the allowable values of value are the same as those for the value attribute of the date element.
